content.raw: I guess it depends on how we intend to use inline namespaces. If we're using them to force users to recompile when this library gets an ABI breaking change, then it doesn't really matter where the inlining is done. If, instead, we're wanting to use them for maintaining backward compatibility when updating the ABI, then it would more consistent if all the namespaces had a signature of `sdf::<version>::<class/another namespace>`. I don't know which use case we had in mind when we started using inline namespaces.
